alert.note: Alert for Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 6:46AM EDT until July 16 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central New York, including the following counties, Columbia, Dutchess, Greene and Ulster. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 646 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Poughkeepsie, Kingston, Beacon, New Paltz, Hudson, Catskill, Saugerties, Rhinebeck, Pawling, Chatham, Wallkill, Hyde Park, Milton, Plattekill, Pleasant Valley, Hurley, Claverack, Wappingers Falls, Amenia and Livingston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
